testing

test_createaccountview module

class testing.test_createaccountview.CreateAccountViewTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

The Test Case for the CreateAccountView

Contains tests for user creation functionality, ensuring correct responses to the functions

setUp()

Sets up the Test Case

Is called before each test to initalise the URL for the user creation end point

Returns:

None

test_create_account_email_exists()

Tests account creation with existing email

Creates user in database

Sends POST request with same email and verifies: - Bad request (400) - Appropriate error message (“Email already exists on a user.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_invalid_email()

Tests account creation with invalid email

Sends POST request with invalid existing email and verifies: - Bad request (400) - Appropriate error message (“Invalid email or username.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_missing_fields()

Tests account creation with missing fields

Sends POST request with already missing password and verifies: - Bad request (400) - Appropriate error message (“‘password’ is missing.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_success()

Test the successful creation of a user account

Sends POST request with valid user data and verifies: - Response status code is OK (200) - Only one user is created in the database - The user email matches the input data

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_weak_password()

Tests account creation with weak password

Sends POST request with intentionlly weak password and verifies: - Bad request (400) - Appropriate error message (“Password is too weak. Use a strong password with at least 6 upper and lower case alpha-numeric characters including special symbols”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_exerciseview module

class testing.test_exerciseview.ExerciseViewTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: APITestCase

The Test Case for the ExerciseView

Contains tests for exercise creation functionality, ensuring correct responses to functions

setUp()

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_create_exercise_success()

Test the successful creation of an exercise

Sends POST request with valid exercise data and verifies: - Response status code is OK (200) - the response contains correct exercise data - The exercise data matches the input data

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

Tests exercise creation with invalid exercise type

Sends POST request with invalid exercise type and verifies:

  • Bad request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Invalid Exercise Type”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

None
